description: Returns an asset (or file) that is in a package. For example, for a Maven package version, use GetPackageVersionAsset to download a JAR file, a POM file, or any other assets in the package version.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The name of the domain that contains the repository that contains the package version with the requested asset.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The repository that contains the package version with the requested asset.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: A format that specifies the type of the package version with the requested asset file.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the package version with the requested asset file. The package component that specifies its namespace depends on its type. For example: The namespace of a Maven package version is its groupId. The namespace of an npm or Swift package version is its scope. The namespace of a generic package is its namespace. Python, NuGet, Ruby, and Cargo package versions do not contain a corresponding component, package versions of those formats do not have a namespace.

parameters.name: package
parameters.description: The name of the package that contains the requested asset.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: A string that contains the package version (for example, 3.5.2).

parameters.name: asset
parameters.description: The name of the requested asset.

nested_items.name: asset
nested_items.description: The binary file, or asset, that is downloaded.

nested_items.name: assetName
nested_items.description: The name of the asset that is downloaded.

nested_items.name: packageVersion
nested_items.description: A string that contains the package version (for example, 3.5.2).

nested_items.name: packageVersionRevision
nested_items.description: The name of the package version revision that contains the downloaded asset.
